intro: Psephellus dittrichii, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its compact size and seasonal blooms. Psephellus dittrichii is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
